channel.title: RS Client Crashing - [FIX]
channel.description:
Okay well I do believe I have found the two main reasons why the client crashes. This is for REAL RS just for those who didn't notice the section ;)
First off,
go to your run and put in [code]DxDiag[/code]
Then, I want you to go to your display tab(may say video? )
If it says you do not have full functionality or if it doesn't show your manufacturer then that means you are using the windows based driver. You need to go to the site of your computer( for me it was acer) go to the driver download section, select your operating system/model/etc.
Now go down to drivers, go to vga drivers(video graphic acceralators (no grammar nazis pl0x xD)
Now...download the one that goes with your computer. (for me it was an intel but yours may be different so you will have to figure that out on your own.
Install the video driver!
You shouldn't have anymore crashing problems.
Fix #2:
Minor fix really...but go to your java (control panel > java) go to settings, uncheck temporary files.

item.title: RS Client Crashing - [FIX]
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I read somewhere(can’t remember where sure if you google it you’ll find it) that cluster fuster made the game less efficient.

FPS isn’t related to your internet connection I’m usually at 50fps even when I’m at 1k ping. I think it may be to do with your graphics card, would make sense.

Read full topic

item.title: RS Client Crashing - [FIX]
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Acorn_, post:11, topic:430327”]Not only black screens too, but has anyone else been experiencing low frame rate issues since the bot nuke?
Even on my gaming computer I have slight frame rate problems.[/quote]I am not 100% sure but fps is mainly from the amount of memory being used. You may be able to go into the java settings panel and change it so java runs using more memory.

Read full topic

item.title: RS Client Crashing - [FIX]
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

[quote=“Acorn_, post:11, topic:430327”]Not only black screens too, but has anyone else been experiencing low frame rate issues since the bot nuke?
Even on my gaming computer I have slight frame rate problems.[/quote]

Yes. When it first happened, and for months after I was at 5fps max. Now whenever I play RS I close out everything else besides Norton and I get around 15fps.

Read full topic

[/quote]
+1
Thanks for the share Love, you should post it on the Rs forums to help other players. They may not be Mopar but it’d be nice to help them out too :P.[/quote]They have one for it already but it is no where as detailed … I will post it later.

item.title: RS Client Crashing - [FIX]
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

dain bramage:

[quote]If it says you do not have full functionality or if it doesn’t show your manufacturer then that means you are using the windows based driver.

This sentence suggests that you don’t know exactly what you’re talking about. Updating your video drivers should be done anyways, since outdated drivers can often function incorrectly with newer technology (perhaps java7, since RS requires an update to that version to run it?).[/quote]Well,

  1. I never 100% claimed to be a “microsoft technician”. I am no where near being at the level of some people but I do know plenty about the software on a computer at any rate(know a few things about different types of servers/networking as well)

  2. This was more of a “user friendly” type of guide.

Read full topic

item.title: RS Client Crashing - [FIX]
item.dc:creator: @dain_bramage dain bramage
item.description:
@dain_bramage wrote:

If it says you do not have full functionality or if it doesn't show your manufacturer then that means you are using the windows based driver.
This sentence suggests that you don't know exactly what you're talking about. Updating your video drivers should be done anyways, since outdated drivers can often function incorrectly with newer technology (perhaps java7, since RS requires an update to that version to run it?).

Read full topic
